intro: Cochlearia officinalis var. lenensis, commonly known as the Lenensian cochlearia, is a rare flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows in coastal habitats, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
